thread.title: Medieval McDonald's in Shrewsbury set to close
thread.title_full: Medieval McDonald's in Shrewsbury set to close

title: Medieval McDonald's in Shrewsbury set to close
text:
Media playback is unsupported on your device Medieval McDonald's in Shrewsbury set to close 21 February 2017 Last updated at 15:20 GMT 
A McDonald's based inside a medieval building in Shrewsbury is set to close. 
With parts of the structure dating back to the 12th Century it is thought to be the oldest in the world to house one of the chain's restaurants. 
The outlet on Pride Hill opened 34 years ago and will shut when the lease expires. 
A spokeswoman for McDonald's said the building "wasn't suitable to meet their future plans".
